name: Hershey Lodge

reviews.text: I had never stayed at this hotel before despite being in Hershey many times on many different occasions. The rooms were great and the hotel itself had plenty to do for the whole family. Indoor and outdoor pool, arcade, mini golf, and more! The hotel really caters to kids. Despite being a bit pricey, it was a very pleasant experience for all of us!
reviews.title: A pretty sweet stay!

reviews.text: from the moment you walk in to the Lobby, you have the feeling that you are someone special and you get the best service in the world the the staff is always so friendly and helpful I would recommend that everyone spend at least visit to Hershey, and you will be hooked for life,this is a must stay for everybody
reviews.title: best vacation ever

reviews.text: My board met here in May 2013 as a change from our usual meeting destinations. The property was a departure in many ways--the resort and spa element were different for us. Reaching the property was a challenge for several of us, who are located across the country. The staff throughout the property--from the bell staff to housekeeping--were warm and welcoming. Hershey does a great job in terms of service excellence. Food (at the Forebay, Hershey Grill, and Lebbie Kebkicher's) was delicious.
reviews.title: Fine for a One-Time Visit

reviews.text: The layout of this property is ridiculous--it is like a small Opryland, and just as frustrating for guests to move about the largely horizontal complex. The maps were confusing.
reviews.title: A Kiss For You

reviews.text: The fitness center is a smallish space trapped within a noisy game room area.
reviews.title: Good and bad
Hershey Lodge
reviews.text: Nice hotel with lots of amenities and fun for kids. We did the package deal with Hershey Park tickets and were able to get into the park early. Shuttle bus to and from for free. We were placed in a older building in the back of the resort and it had a damp feel to it. The lobby is nice and great gift shop. We did eat a the beanery in the lobby area and it was all packaged foods for on the go. We ate at the other restaurant and was very happy wih service and quality of food. Better choice if you have time.

reviews.title: These guys are good!
reviews.text: This is like staying at a Ritz with nicer people. Every person on staff has a warm welcoming can do attitude. They are being invaded by our group and they all act like they are so happy to see us. Every request is well received and responded to immediately.

reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!!!
reviews.text: Rooms are spotless and well appointed. The free internet is a nice touch and the beds are very comfortable.

reviews.title: Family friendly
reviews.text: The on-site restaurants offer great variety and fair prices on food and drink,

reviews.title: Giant Size with Personal Service
reviews.text: If you are going to Hershey park this is the perfect hotel.

reviews.title: A sweet time at the Hershey Lodge
reviews.text: We purchased a package for a stay at the Hershey Lodge as an end-of-the-school-year treat for our two daughters. The package included a deluxe room, free breakfast ( for kids), and tickets to Hershey Park, and two other Hershey attractions.

reviews.title: Way, way overpriced but comfortable.
reviews.text: We arrived just after 3PM. Throughout our stay, we noticed that the staff is very well trained, cordial, efficient, knowledgeable. The Lodge is large, with several wings and a large meeting space/convention hall attached to it. The landscape is very well manicured and the interior spaces are well maintained with comfortable seating throughout the lobby. The Recreation building with the pools and game rooms are at the far end of the property and a long walk unless you are staying in the wing closest to that area. Our room was in the Kisse's wing and we found it very comfortable, though there was nothing "deluxe" about it.s. It came with a mini-fridge which is a nice amenity when traveling with kids. The bathroom was a little tight, but my only real complaint with the room is that the walls are a bit thin; we heard a lot of hallway conversations and screaming/running toddlers and the A/C unit is loud. Though it cooled the room, I so think that an HVAC upgrade may be overdue for the lodge.

reviews.title: Good...Not Great...
reviews.text: We had a late lunch at the Hershey Grill ( decent food and service and reasonably priced) and took their shuttle service to the park. The ride is about 10 minutes and the shuttle runs non-stop until 11pm. Depending on the driver, you will get a tour narration during the drive. Again, the shuttle drivers are well trained, friendly and knowledgeable.We had a little issue at the park with our entry passes, but after a brief phone call back to the lodge, my wife had it resolved and when we returned we had free passes for the park waiting under our door. I did not eat breakfast the next morning, but my wife and kids said it was very good and the food was well prepared, fresh and hot.

reviews.title: Great place for a convention/conference
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Hershey and I cannot imagine it being a better experience for what was approximately a 24-hour visit ( Friday afternoon to Saturday afternoon). The Lodge staff were all well trained and friendly. There was none of that thinly veiled contempt you get from family friendly tourist destination workers. Everyone seemed welcoming and glad to offer assistance or service if called upon. I was most impressed that the hotel had three lifeguards on duty; two at the indoor pool and one at the outdoor. The pools were not huge, but the number of kids must mandate a high safety standard and it was impressive.

reviews.title: Wonderfull place to stay in Hershey
reviews.text: I look forward to making a return trip later this year and do recommend making the Hershey Lodge your hotel choice when going to Hershey.

reviews.title: Don't go for the customer service or price
reviews.text: I stayed with my husband who was on business. I was there for 24 hours, my husband stayed 4 days. The 1st day he came back to the room after being at work to his room door open. In the 24 hours I was there here is my experience. Twice the concierge gave us wrong information. We were told there was no rental car office when our company told us a rental car would be waiting for us. There is a rental car office in the convention center area. They told us the outdoor pool was open, it was not! The vending drink machines on each floor would only take credit cards or a $1 coin. The machine charged my credit card twice and gave me no drinks. When I told the front desk what had happened they couldn't believe the machine would not take cash and had never heard of a $1 gold coin! I was told it was my problem since it was on my credit card! To top it off our room was surrounded by a group of middle school children who were shouting, jumping off beds and slamming doors until midnight and it started again at 6:00 a.m. All this for $250 a night. The lack of customer service was shocking for a 5* hotel and more so on a not so busy Thursday!!

reviews.title: Hershey Family Getaway
reviews.text: The shining star was Lebbie's, we had breakfast there twice. The food & service was excellent!

reviews.title: Best little family getaway
reviews.text: I recommend the Hershey Park package. It includes a night at the lodge, tickets to the park with one hour early park admission with transportation, the Hershey Museum and gardens. Don't forget after you return from a day at the park to stop for an well work it adult treat at the Bear's Den. Purchase a frozen Chocolate Buzz Martini with a dark chocolate kiss at the bottom, yum, you even get to keep the glasses.

reviews.title: Chocolate Rules - Hershey Lodge Great Hotel for Families
reviews.text: we just returned from our little family getaway for memorial day weekend... our plan was to stay overnight but when i saw the smile on my little boys faces who are 2 and 1 years of age there was no way we could have left that soon.. we decided to stay one more night and give them extra day of fun. Their smiles made my trip EXCELLENT... the rooms were gorgeous and very very clean ... the food was great and staff was amazing.. all of the characters were great and my babies weekend.. we will definitely be staying at the hershey lodge again .. and hope to keep the new tradition we created. thank you hershey and the staff... we shall see you soon

reviews.title: Nice stay, but the price is too high
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay during the Memorial Day weekend at the Hershey Lodge. Hotel was great - several restaurants on-site to choose from and a cafe that sells sandwiches, coffee, drinks and ice cream. We had room service twice which makes it very convenient for those of us with young kids who don't always behave at restaurants. The hotel is very large and has a tennis court, mini-golf, indoor and outdoor pools, a game room and an exercise room so lot's to do. The staff was great and there was a full schedule of activities for the kids. We did not participate in any activities as there was so much to do outside the hotel so we were gone for most of the day. The outdoor pool looks nice, but is not heated so if it's cold outside the water is probably ice cold. The indoor pool looks on the small side and when we visited it it was packed with hotel guests so we opted for the game room which was decent, although on the small side as well. The mini golf is 18 holes but is simple in design - no fancy windmills or other designs on the course.

description: A great place for families to stay while visiting Hersheypark.
